reviews.title: Truly effective, but so is baking soda
reviews.content: In case you were wondering what Calcium Carbonate is, it is baking soda and works great for heartburn and upset stomach. I have been using a half teaspoon of baking soda for nearly a year now and am a huge believer. Baking soda costs less than a dollar a box and lasts me at least a few months. This is 14$ and lasts just over a month.Dissolving the soda in a cup of water is easy and I drink it down quickly. These are chalky like tums and stick in your teeth, giving you a crappy taste for quite a while.I still give this product 4 stars because it works really well and is easy to carry. I plan on using these when I travel because they are much handier than a box of soda. But for daily use I'm going to stick with the cheaper option. But both work really well.

reviews.title: Happiness and Neutralized Stomach Acid
reviews.content: First, I'd like to start by saying how excited I was to find Genexa products on Amazon. I've seen some other places and not had a need to try them yet. Their time has finally arrived!They are a little bit more expensive than Tums antacids, but as someone who can't have food coloring, these are a godsend! I've been having some acid reflux recently and needed something to quell it. The only reason that I had to give this 4 stars instead of 5 is because there's a slightly strange aftertaste. It's not really a bad taste, but it's weird. However, that being said, it's easy enough to wash down with just water. I'd rather have something with a slightly weird aftertaste that I can get to go away in like 2 seconds than something full of food coloring. I know some people are weird about textures, and this is slightly chalky of a texture when you chew it, but it wasn't enough to bother me. I mean, it is a chewable tablet, what else can you expect? Functionally, it worked wonderfully for me!  There was only one time that I even had to take a second one even though the directions start at 2 tablets. I will definitely buy these again!

reviews.title: Less than 1/4 the cost of the original flavor

The foam floats on the top of the stomach liquid (acid) and therefore protects when it is refluxed up to your throat. So you have to learn a technique for chewing the tablets into a medium/small size and rapidly swallowing them before they fizz and stick to your teeth.  The taste is so repugnant that i cannot imagine anyone using these things on a regular basis.Do they work?  Yes, they help with the burning sensation, but so do Tums and their generic equivalent, at a fraction of the cost.  I threw mine away, life is too short to have to endure this crap.

reviews.title: Good acid reflux healing
reviews.content: Tums Extra Strength is an over-the-counter antacid medication that is used to treat symptoms of heartburn, indigestion, and acid reflux. The active ingredient in Tums Extra Strength is calcium carbonate, which works by neutralizing stomach acid and reducing the burning sensation associated with acid reflux.One of the key benefits of Tums Extra Strength is its fast-acting formula, which can provide relief from heartburn and indigestion in as little as 30 seconds. The tablets are also easy to take and come in a variety of flavors, making them a convenient option for people who suffer from occasional bouts of heartburn.Overall, Tums Extra Strength is a safe and effective option for people who experience occasional heartburn and indigestion. Its fast-acting formula and variety of flavors make it a convenient choice, and its over-the-counter availability makes it easily accessible for most people. However, it is important to talk to a healthcare provider before using Tums Extra Strength or any other medication, especially if you have a history of gastrointestinal problems or are taking other medications.

reviews.title: Received Damaged - Amazon doesn't offer return/exchange - Must contact Manufacturer
reviews.content: This isn't the first time I have received damaged bottles like this.  Last time Amazon sent replacements but it may have been their brand of chews.  For Alka Seltzer chews I was instructed to contact the manufacturer.  Called their hotline but waited on hold for more than 30 minutes with no answer.  Ended up filling out complaint form online but haven't received any notification that they've received my complaint. I like this product a lot and have a subscription to have 200 chews delivered every 4 months, but if this issue isn't resolved I will cancel the subscription and consider alternatives.  I will update my review if the issue is resolved.UPDATE:  About a week went by after submitting my complaint to the manufacturer (Bayer) there was still no communication from a representative, however I finally received an email notification that a FedEx delivery was headed my way.  Waited a couple more days and the package finally arrived only to find that it was a letter instructing me to return the defective product with a prepaid label.  What??  Surely this could have been communicated via email and settled in a much timelier manner.  By this time I had already disposed of the product, but not before taking photos of proof just in case it was needed.  Since I no longer had the physical product, I called the customer support line again, this time being connected to a representative within a few short minutes.  I explained the situation to this person who checked with his manager (I presume) who said emailing the photos should suffice.  I sent an email with the photo attachments and other information (date of purchase, amazon order number, etc.) to the address that he gave me and within 24 hours received an email from another representative stating my refund check would be placed in the mail which I should receive within 10 business days.  Then later that same day I received an email from the representative that I spoke to on the phone, requesting that I email the photos and include information about the Amazon purchase.  I was a bit confused at this point as I had already sent the photos and information as well as informed that a refund check was on its way.  Regardless I obliged and resent the photos and information as requested.  No further communication came from Bayer representatives and I finally received the refund check within the 10 day window.  Since there have been so many other reviewers showing similar problems with broken seals and containers, I have decided it's not worth continuing the subscription on Amazon.  There's no way I want to go through this hassle again.  I'll just go to Walmart and pick up a new bottle when needed.  Upped my overall rating from 3 to 4 stars only because I like using this product. The company (or Amazon) should use a better method for shipping this item.  Perhaps use a box rather than a flimsy bubble wrap envelope.  Cheers!

reviews.title: WAY too much sugar
reviews.content: This is a decent product‚Äîbetter than Tums, not as effective as Pepcid AC. But where they lose me is with the enormous amounts of sugar they add to each chewable. They literally have ‚Äúcorn syrup‚Äù listed as one of the ingredients! I ended up throwing the entire bottle away after the first dosage; complete waste of money.For the life of me, I cannot understand why companies making MEDICATIONS‚Äîantacids, cough medicines, etc‚Äîfeel the need to saturate their products with sugar. We want it to taste good, yes, but it‚Äôs not supposed to be candy! And for those of us who can‚Äôt have sugar, it‚Äôs problematic to not have a reasonable ‚Äúheads up‚Äù that this is a product we can‚Äôt have. What about people with diabetes? What about people on Keto diets? It seems that there‚Äôs less and less of the ‚Äúsugar free‚Äù variety of these otc remedies and more and more hidden sugar everywhere you look.If you‚Äôre going to make something like Alka Seltzer a veritable dessert, then you should be required to add nutritional labeling to the bottle, PERIOD.

reviews.title: Health-Conscious Antacid with Mixed Taste
reviews.content: Being prone to occasional acid reflux, I often rely on store-brand antacids from retailers like Target or Walmart. They typically offer a range of fruity flavors that make them quite palatable, akin to Smarties candy.Enter Wonder Belly Antacid, boasting a formula free from talc, dyes, parabens, and artificial sweeteners. Intrigued by its health-conscious composition, I eagerly tried it, only to find the taste falling short of expectations.Despite my initial excitement for its purported health benefits, the taste of Wonder Belly Antacid left much to be desired. While I value natural ingredients, the flavor didn't quite hit the mark for me. Nonetheless, prioritizing health over taste, I'm inclined to continue consuming it.Additionally, I observed that the product comes in an aluminum bottle, packaged within a small cardboard box. While I appreciate the effort to minimize harmful ingredients, I couldn't help but feel the cardboard packaging was unnecessary and wasteful.In summary, Wonder Belly Antacid presents a health-conscious option for managing acid reflux, but its taste may not appeal to everyone. While I commend its natural formulation, improvements could be made in flavor and packaging efficiency.

reviews.title: Need to think about the value
reviews.content: I usually don't mention price, but in this case, the shopper would really need to justify paying $.24 (as of 10/9/22) per tablet for these. They are upfront about the fact the active ingredient is exactly the same as in many other antacid tablets. I used these and they work the same as the big name products, but I'm pretty sure if you frequently consume antacids, you are not going to shell out 4 times more per tablet than, say, Tums Naturals, which have the same amount of calcium carbonate and check off a couple of the same sales points as this product.They may be worth it if you are sensitive to any unnatural or unnecessary ingredients, like dyes or sweeteners, which some other brands may or may not contain. And they do come in cute aluminum cans, that probably have a greater chance of actually getting recycled than plastic containers. Then again, 180 of these tablets come in 3 containers versus 1 container for the same amount of the name brands (as of this writing, these only seem to be offered in 60 tablet cans).It's up to you. My 3 star rating is meant to indicate the pluses and minuses could go either way, depending on the shopper.

reviews.title: Vanilla Strawberry Tablets Stuck to my teeth, Safety Seal easily tampered with
reviews.content: I have been a fan of Simethicone for years. While I consider the well known brand (G__Ex) to be a staple of our "first aid" cabinet, this one works, but does not appeal in the same way to me . That said, here's my longer review with more details:Company Transparency: Trademark Activity for ‚ÄúWonderbelly‚Äù is first noted in 2021. They have a really cute and information dense webpage with an ‚ÄúAbout Us‚Äù that says their Ginger Health company was started by Lucas Kraft (who‚Äôd struggled with gut issues) and his business oriented brother Noah. They ‚Äúput together an amazing team of gastroenterologists and pharmaceutical scientists‚Äù to create products that don‚Äôt  use ingredients like dyes, talc, or artificial sweeteners (note: That doesn't mean "filler free"). They provide biographies of their team of three medical advisors!Accountability for Safety: They claim to be  "clean label project" certified, vegan, non-GMO, and free of artificial dyes, artificial sweeteners, talc, titanium dioxide, parabens, gluten and dairy. Although most of  Wonderbelly's antacids are verifiably Clean Label Project Certified (checks for things like lead, purity), I don‚Äôt see this product listed at the Clean Label Project webpage (yet?). (In theory the CL Project certification *might*  be as good as GMP certified, even better in a sense, because it tests store bought product that is purchased anonymously, not samples provided by the company. And then they do spot checks periodically. Genius!) (Disclaimer: Just my uneducated opinion about the value of the testing).Quality: Unfortunately the unique safety seal on this is easily tampered with. I can lift it and replace it so that it looks like it did originally. Otherwise, this container includes 42 chewable simethicone tablets that each contain 125 mg of Simethicone, which is the same amount as Gas-Ex Extra strength. They recommend taking 1-3 tablets with symptoms. They have a strong vanilla/strawberry scent, and taste the same (not personally a fan).  They don't dissolve quickly as I chew, but are dry and become a damp clump that sticks to my teeth. The ingredients are said to be ‚ÄúClean‚Äù.  They seem to work for me, bringing quick relief (simethicone is great).I was happy to see other folks enjoyed these, because although I love strawberry shortcake, these just didn't do it for me. They stuck to and filled in the crevices of my molars so that the taste lingered for a long time (I have lots of dental work, so maybe that's the issue?), but I love the "Clean Label project" quality verification idea and that some of Wonderbelly's products can be verified in that program!
